name: synopsys-coverity
description: The Azure Dev Ops plugin for Synopsys Coverity.
author: Synopsys

inputs.name: coverityService
inputs.label: Coverity Service Endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The Synopsys Coverity connect instance this task will run against.
The url, username and password will be stored in COV_URL, COV_USER and COVERITY_PASSPHRASE and will affect both the full and incremental analysis.

inputs.name: projectName
inputs.label: Project name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The name of the project to use on the Coverity Server.
The resulting project name is stored in COV_PROJECT and will affect both the full and incremental analysis.
The task will first verify that this project exists on the connect instance.

inputs.name: streamName
inputs.label: Stream name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The name of the stream to use on the Coverity Server.
The resulting stream name is stored in COV_STREAM and will affect both the full and incremental analysis.
The task will first verify that this stream exists on the given project in the connect instance.

inputs.name: checkIssues
inputs.label: Check for issues
inputs.helpMarkDown: If enabled, this task will check a given Coverity View for defects and update the task status based on those results.

inputs.name: issueView
inputs.label: Coverity view
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The name of the view you would like to check for issues on the Coverity Server.
The resulting view name is stored in COV_VIEW and will affect both the full and incremental analysis.
The task will first verify that this stream exists on the given project in the connect instance.

inputs.name: issueStatus
inputs.label: Build status if issues are present
inputs.helpMarkDown: The task status to set if issues are found in the configured view.

inputs.name: coverityBuildDirectory
inputs.label: Coverity Build Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The working directory to use for coverity when executing the commands. The recommended default is $(Build.Repository.LocalPath).

options.buildanalyzecommit: Run Coverity build, analyze and commit defects

inputs.name: coverityAnalysisType
inputs.label: Analysis type
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify the type of analysis you would like to run.
Full Analysis will run cov-build, cov-analyze and cov-commit-defects in that order.
Incremental Analysis will run the cov-build, cov-run-desktop, and cov-commit-defects commands in that order.

The commands will be run with the following parameters:
cov-build --dir {build directory}/idir {build command}
cov-analyze --dir {build directory}/idir
cov-run-desktop --dir {build directory}/idir --url {coverity service url} {change set}
cov-commit-defects --dir {build directory}/idir --url {coverity service url} --stream {stream name}

inputs.name: covBuildArgs
inputs.label: cov-build
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify additional arguments to apply to the invocation of the cov-build command. Affects full and incremental analysis.

NOTE: The following options are automatically provied and should not be provided here. If you wish to override the provided arguments, use 'Run custom Coverity command' instead.
--dir {build directory}/idir {build command}

inputs.name: covAnalyzeArgs
inputs.label: cov-analyze
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify additional arguments to apply to the invocation of the cov-analyze command. Affects full and incremental analysis.

NOTE: The following options are automatically provied and should not be provided here. If you wish to override the provided arguments, use 'Run custom Coverity command' instead.
--dir {build directory}/idir

inputs.name: covDesktopArgs
inputs.label: cov-run-desktop
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify additional arguments to apply to the invocation of the cov-run-desktop command. Affects full and incremental analysis.

NOTE: The following options are automatically provied and should not be provided here. If you wish to override the provided arguments, use 'Run custom Coverity command' instead.
--dir {build directory}/idir --url {coverity service url} {change set}

inputs.name: covCommitArgs
inputs.label: cov-commit-defects
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify additional arguments to apply to the invocation of the cov-commit-defects command. Affects full and incremental analysis.

NOTE: The following options are automatically provied and should not be provided here. If you wish to override the provided arguments, use 'Run custom Coverity command' instead.
--dir {build directory}/idir --url {coverity service url} --stream {stream name}

inputs.name: customCoverityCommands
inputs.label: Custom coverity commands
inputs.helpMarkDown: List of Coverity commands seperated by newlines. Commands should look like cov-build or cov-analyze. All ADO environment variables are available using $(variable) as well as Coverity Extension environment variables using $coverityvariable.

inputs.name: allowUntrusted
inputs.label: Allow self signed certificates
inputs.helpMarkDown: If enabled, this task will allow connection to a self signed coverity instance.
